name: NodeSchool Augsburg
description:
** Englisch version below **

Du wolltest schon immer mal programmieren? Oder willst endlich mal Node.js ausprobieren? Nimm teil und lerne Programmieren mit Node.js ganz einfach - versprochen! Es hilft, wenn du schon mal etwas mit JavaScript gemacht hast - wenn nicht, komm trotzdem! Wir helfen gern.

Du lernst mit kleinen Programmen, die du selbst schreibst - keine langweiligen Vorträge! Alle Aufgaben sind Open Source und online unter nodeschool.io verfügbar, so kannst du auch ganz einfach nach der NodeSchool selber weiter lernen.

Wir finden programmieren großartig und möchten ein Event für alle machen. Das bedeutet, wir freuen uns über alle Teilnehmer - ganz gleich wie fit ihr schon mit JavaScript oder Node.js seid. Wir erwarten aber auch, dass alle genauso großartig zueinander sind und unseren Code of Conduct respektieren.

---

Join us and learn coding with us. You are going to learn the basics of Node.js. It's a plus if you know some JavaScript beforehand, but if not we can help you out.

You will go through a set of self-paced challenges. No boring talks. All challenges are Open Source and available online on nodeschool.io. This means you can continue learning after the event.

We think coding is awesome and everyone should feel welcome at our event. This includes that we are expecting all participants to be awesome to each other and respect the Code of Conduct.

name: Nodeschool Dallas
description:
Come to these workshops to learn Node.JS and work through challenges as a team.

Node.js is a javascript runtime for server applications.  Node.js provides an event-driven architecture and a non-blocking I/O API that optimizes an application's throughput and scalability.

Nodeschool is an interactive workshop run through the command line and a text editor on your laptop.  Come hack with us.

name: Northern Colorado Meshnet
description:
This is a group of individuals interest in creating a decentralized mesh network in Fort Collins and the surrounding communities. A meshnet would provide a secure digital network owned by it participants. We hope to peer with the Boulder and Denver meshnets in the future. Join our mailing list at https://nocomesh.net


If you're interested in digital privacy or new technologies stop by a Meetup to learn more about the project. The Northern Colorado Meshnet aims to experiment with a decentralized and public wireless/wired network ran by individuals joining the network as "nodes". Traffic is encrypted and passed from node to node until it reaches its final destination, allowing for redundancy and security within the network.


Our Meetups will be informal and casual and will likely not go the entire scheduled time. Stop by at the beginning of the scheduled time to toss around ideas, get updates on the current state of the project or to learn about the meshnet.


The project is open to anyone and everyone. Any technical skill level or even non-technical individuals.

name: NodeBR - São Paulo
description:
A NodeBR é uma comunidade fundada por pessoas com interesse em aprender mais sobre Node.js assim como ajudar outras pessoas que possuem dúvidas nessa plataforma. No momento a comunidade é constituída por estes pontos de acesso principal

* A lista de e-mails é um grupo no Google onde você pode cadastrar o seu endereço de e-mail para enviar e receber e-mails das outras pessoas cadastradas. Esta lista mostrou-se extremamente eficaz na resolução de dúvidas de pessoas iniciantes no Node.js, assim como também é o ponto de encontro de discussões proveitosas e notícias sobre a plataforma.

* Nosso canal #nodebr no IRC é uma ferramenta de bate papo em tempo real, onde programadores trocam ideias e tiram dúvidas com outros membros que estão online, a ferramenta é nova e cresce junto com a comunidade. Para quem já possui instalado algum client IRC, nos achará facilmente no canal #nodebr na rede freenode.net, para aqueles que ainda não possuem um, podem acessar o link anterior para abrir o web chat e entrar diretamente no canal.

* O grupo de Meetup de São Paulo é onde organizamos nossos encontros e marcamos os eventos mensais que trazem informação e novidades sobre o mundo do Node.js.

* O site oficial da comunidade está em fase de planejamento mas já é uma ferramenta extramente importante na nossa comunidade, visto que ela abrigará as principais ferramentas que a comunidade julga importante, como você pode ver no brainstorming.

* @nodebr no Twitter.

Contribua para o projeto

Para começar a contribuir você deve procurar por alguma issue em aberto, veja aquela que você consiga resolver com facilidade. O próximo passo é fazer o fork do projeto e mandar uma pull request.

Links importantes

Lista de e-mail: https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=pt#!forum/nodebr
NodeBR no IRC: https://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=#nodebr
Site da comunidade: http://nodebr.org
Site do Meetup de São Paulo: http://www.meetup.com/Node-js-Sao-Paulo

name: Shaston Hackers - old and new coding
description:
Coders interested in new cloud technologies, and sharing war stories of development and operations. CloudFoundry, node.js, RPG/400, COBOL, c#, VB, ASM, Ruby, python -- bring them all. looking for members to get going in May 2015

First meeting will have an overview and demo of BlueMix  -- the IBM Cloud Foundry platform for developers; after that, I'd like to introduce node-red -- a great tool for wiring node.js to the world.

name: Nodeschool Munich
description:
Du wolltest schon immer mal programmieren? Oder willst endlich mal node.js ausprobieren? Nimm teil und lerne das Programmieren mit node.js ganz einfach - versprochen! Es hilft, wenn du schon mal etwas mit JavaScript gemacht hast - wenn nicht, komm trotzdem! Wir helfen gern.

--- Join us and learn coding with us. You are going to learn the basics of node.js. It's a plus if you know some JavaScript beforehand, but if not we can help you out.

name: Reykjavík Nodecopter
description:
It's finally time!
And when I say finally time, I mean it's finally time to mess around with robots and node.js!

Oz Inc. would like to invite you to a amazing event that involves hacking on drones and has already been held in different cities around the world.

January 10th 2015 we will gather in Reykjavík University to do the following:

Listen to short talks about node.js.
Hack on drones in node.js.
Eat food and drink beers and sodas.
Have a kickass time.
Check out nodecopter.com for more info about nodecopter events and check out our github for more info about nodecopter Reykjavík.

Things you need:

5000ISK for registration.
Your own laptop.
Some programming experience.
We'll provide:

A single AR Drone 2.0 to mess around with (one per team).
Beer and pizzas.
Wifi!
Did we mention we'll let you mess around with a f'ing drone???
Afterwards we'll all meet up at Oz HQ to have beers, mingle and be merry.

name: NodeBR - Minas Gerais
description:
A NodeBR é uma comunidade fundada por pessoas com interesse em aprender mais sobre Node.js assim como ajudar outras pessoas que possuem dúvidas nessa plataforma. No momento a comunidade é constituída por estes pontos de acesso principal

Site do Meetup do Rio de Janeiro: http://www.meetup.com/Node-js-Rio-de-Janeiro

name: TechMalaga
description: Node Sol nacio con la mision de conectar apasionados del Node en Málaga. Hemos hecho varias charlas y workshops y constantemente planificamos nuevos eventos alrededor de las tendencias más innovadoras en la web: Node.js, Angular, Python, API's, Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, Erlang, Swift, socket.io, MongoDb, Redis, Cassandra, AWS y herramientas para desarrolladores.

name: nodeJS Devs
description:
Understanding Node.js can have a significant positive impact on your career as a Javascript developer. Knowing how it works, how it scales, and how to interact with it can save you time, headaches and delays going to production which can put you well ahead of your competition. Understanding node.js can help you architect applications that are built to work with node's features and capabilities.

This group is for both beginners as well as advanced javascript developers to meet and share their knowledge of nodeJS and Javascript.

From building IoT applications to mobile apps and chatbots, this group is for every JS developer who has an interest in knowing what is ahead of the curve.

organizer.name: Gaurav
organizer.bio: Founder, funstore.io :- An on-boarding platform for IoT.  If you have developed a solution for IoT and want your users and developers to get onboard quickly, we can help you do that. Feel free to ping!

name: The Future is made in Javascript
description:
Harness the power of Javascript!

Javascript is the language that was lucky enough to become the most important programing language today:

·  It is the one and only language natively spoken by web browsers (location, location, location)

·  It is used for building mobile HTML5 applications (i.e. with PhoneGap)

·  It is used for building data-intensive scalable servers (with Node.js)

·  It is used to build Desktop applications (such as Atom.io or http://breach.cc/)  

·  It is used to program hardware (the rise of JS robotics http://nodebots.io/, https://tessel.io/ ) 


2015 will be one of the most important years for Javascript, as ECMA6 is getting to its final stages – JS will have Classes, Inheritance, Packages and all the things were missing.

Angular.js is a library (by Google) that has changed the way people write Javascript at the browser side. during 2015 we will get Angular 2.0 (oops they did it again) and 2015 will also be the year of web components. 


Not convinced?

·  JavaScript is the #1 most-used language on GitHub


·  Paypal has replaced their entire server side to Node.js: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6phif2t-wj0

·  For the past few years, most public REST APIs returns JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) as their primary data format.

·  Most NoSQL vendors save JSON in the database…



At misterBIT.co.il we are focused at the most recent tools to help startups and enterprise organizations find their path in the Javascript world and take it to the next level.

next_event.name: Build an Angular  application from the ground up, 6 day workshop

name: Silicon Vikings Stockholm Chapter
description:
Silicon Vikings is a 40,000+ network headquartered in Silicon Valley with nodes throughout the Nordic and Baltic region including Copenhagen, Gothenburg, Northern Sweden, Helsinki, Oslo, Reykjavik, Riga, Stockholm, Tallinn, and Vilnius. Silicon Vikings is a network of nodes with the mission of building a borderless community supporting Nordic and Baltic innovation and entrepreneurship in accordance with global best practices, with a close connection to Silicon Valley’s unique and leading innovation and entrepreneurship ecosystem.

Our goal at the Stockholm chapter is to connect the start-up and tech communities in Silicon Valley and Stockholm and to build bridges between entrepreneurs and professionals who aspire to gain and share knowledge on the latest advancements. We look forward to seeing you at our events!

Join our newsletter here:

www.siliconvikings.com

organizer.name: David Hagen
organizer.bio: Digital Marketing specialist & Board member at Silicon Vikings Stockholm. Passionate about science, start-ups, music, film, sports and making friends.

name: I Teach You Programming, So You Teach Me English!
description:
〜 In return for learning programming, please teach me English 〜 


I think it would be good if we could form a group of these people 

• People interested in learning programming or design that can also speak English. 

• Designers or Programmers that want to learn English 



Things that I can teach

my specialty is web based programming: 

Front-end(HTML/CSS,JavaScript,Flash) 

Back-end(Node.js,PHP,[Ruby, Python]) 

I also have some skills in animation and 3D 

Also I'm writing a book on jQuery, 

and think I would be able to do a reasonable job teaching that. 

If our programmer and designer members increase 

we can also increase what we are able to teach 

translate by Lochran Huck


〜 プログラミング教えるので、英語教えてください 〜


こんな人たちがあつまるといいなぁ

• プログラムやデザインを勉強したい英語ができる人

• 英語を勉強したいプログラマやデザイナ


教えられる事

自分が得意としているのはｗeb系のプログラムで、

Front-end(HTML/CSS,JavaScript,Flash)も、

Back-end(Node.js,PHP,[Ruby, Python])もできます。

アニメーションや3Dなんかもできます。

なにげにjQueryの本とか執筆しているので、

そこそこ教えることができると思います。

プログラマやデザイナのメンバーが増えたら、

教えられる事の項目は増やしていきます。


Lochran Huckさんが翻訳してくれました。

ありがとうございます。

organizer.name: Hiroaki Yasutomo
organizer.bio:
I'm a web developer. work in design studio SHIFTBRAIN Inc. in Tokyo Japan. http://www.shiftbrain.co.jp/
I can't speak English. :'-(

name: DevX: Trendy Technologies!
description:
A development space for professional Mobile & Web Developers both front-end and backend: Node.JS, PHP, C++,.NET, Java, Python, Go, Ruby on Rail... from orientation to advanced topics such as recomendation, big data, large scale performance...<br>

Here is also a playground for mobile developers: newest and most updated mobile - Android, iOS, mobile front-end and backend technologies. For ex: Node.JS, React, Express, Object C, Android Java, Firebase... Look forward to meeting with the hardcore mobile developers in Bangkok!

Our purpose is to use cool technology to build great products! Let's enjoy the game!

Join us on Facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/TrendyDevX/

name: LoopBack Buenos Aires
description: Este es un grupo para todos los desarrolladores de software de back-end que utilizan o están interesado en utilizar este controversial framework de Node.js que corre sobre Express, que permite crear rápidamente API REST y que cuenta con SDKs cliente para Angular JS, Android, iOS y Xamarin. Como así también para todos los desarrolladores JavaScript de front-end que quieran ingresar en el mundo de back-end a través de Node.js y Express, aprovechando las herramientas que este framework provee.

name: NodeSchool Wrocław
description: Chcesz bliżej poznać Node.js i napisać pierwszą aplikację? Zapraszamy! NodeSchool to prowadzony przez wolontariuszy projekt open source, który ma dwa główne cele: tworzyć wysokiej jakości program edukacyjny oraz organizować spotkania warsztatowe dla społeczności. Jeśli już znasz Node.js i chciałbyś do nas dołączyć - odezwij się! Nie zapomnijcie wziąć ze sobą laptopów i do zobaczenia na następnym workshopie!

name: Next Gen Application Developers Nairobi
description:
This is an IBM sponsored meetup group. 
Geared towards developers and technologists who want to create great apps. To build the next generation of apps we must change:
- How we scale apps
- How we build and test
- Where applications run
- How apps communicate
Even the definition of what makes an application has changed with Cloud, Mobile and Internet of Things. Our meetups give you the opportunity to get hands on with new and proven technologies to build applications designed for this new world of Cloud, Web, Mobile, Social and Internet of Things.

Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation to provide an introduction to technologies and techniques to help overcome the challenges of building next generation apps. This is usually followed by several hours of hands on experience working alongside fellow developers, and meeting with the developers behind the tools. There is often an opportunity to be among the first to experience alpha/beta technologies from IBM. We provide access to all the tools including in the cloud environment. Just bring your laptops. Of course, all our meetups are free to attend and no marketing or sales pitches are permitted. Meetup topics include:
- Building production-ready node.js, Java and Ruby using the Cloud
- Creating applications and deploying in the Cloud using open platform-as-a-service technology IBM BlueMix
- Wiring the Internet of Things to the Cloud using Node-Red, MQTT 
- Scaling Java applications using WAS Liberty
- Improving responsiveness of applications using Elastic MQ messaging

organizer.name: Ben Mann
organizer.bio: Ben Mann is Program Director of Africa Software Offerings at IBM based in Nairobi, Kenya. His areas of expertise include Cloud, the Bluemix Innovation Platform, Mobile, Big Data Analytics, Cognitive Computing, Middleware and the Internet of Things.

name: Realtime Streaming Analytics & In Memory Grid computing
description:
This meet up about how real time streaming analytics fits into a big data architecture, when stream processing makes sense, and what technologies and products you can choose from.

This meet up is geared to discuss the following:

a) Data capturing methodologies (both realtime and batch) that includes capturing changes from database transaction logs (CDC), messaging systems, Kafka, Hadoop, files, IOTs

b) Realtime and In memory analytics - using continuous query processing system, windowing, caching, aggregating the data. Also covers data distribution
across various nodes and clustering across the nodes for the optimal data distribution

c) Data delivery - Cloud (AWS, Azure and Google), Databases , Kafka , NoSQL, Hadoop, IOTs

d) Solving uses cases - from fraud detection, on premise data migration for cloud analytics , transaction monitoring system, enterprise data bus, IOT tracking system, edge analytics etc

e) Realtime analytics - application life cycle

This meet up is mainly for software engineers, data scientists, application developers and CTO of the organization who wants to know and build realtime streaming analytical application using latest trend in the industry.

name: SFNode
description:
SFNode is a community run Node.js meetup in San Francisco created by dshaw. We meet on the first Thursday of each month.

Our location changes month to month. If you have an event space, we'd love to have you host. The event host typically provides food and drink, but if you're not able to we can usually find a sponsor for that.

Each month we feature 2-3 talks about Node.js, server-side JavaScript, npm and the surrounding ecosystem. We try to find a good balance between beginner and advanced topics.

If you want to help, we are always looking for contributors. Join us.

Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/sfnode .

organizer.name: Dan Shaw
organizer.bio: CTO and Co-Founder of NodeSource, the Enterprise Node.js Company.

name: NodeMN
description: A group for anyone interested in Node.js regardless of skill level or experience. Join us in discussing the latest frameworks, projects, conferences and hacks using anything node.
